author: Brock_the_Builder
title: Simplicity at its best
review:
I have been re-assembling Legos for days after pulling them out of the closet after 20+ years.  I had the instructions for 98% of my sets.  At the end, I had certain pieces left over that were unique-- in this case, the forklift piece.

After searching Brickset for 'forklift', I stumbled upon this gem, and my memory was awakened.  I had all the pieces to recreate this little beauty.

This is a very simple set, and may be my earliest memory of Lego.  A real classic.

author: Kramii
title: One of the great pre-minifig sets
review:
As a child, this was one of my all-time favourite sets.

This model has just 21 pieces, and its simplicity meant that I regularly disassembled and reassembled it (often following a "car crash") and took great delight in being able to rebuild without glancing at the instructions.

The minifig included with the set is old-style, and this may be a little off-putting to some collectors. However, these minifigs were real progress before the introduction of articulated minifigs. Indeed, I vividly recall that this little guy found himself protagonist in many of my LEGO-based adventures, and driver of many a MOC. Moreover, my 8 year old son is as happy to play with these old-style figures as he is to play with their modern counterparts.

Of course, compared to modern sets, this set looks rather primitive and "blocky", so if you're looking for an elegant display piece this isn't for you.. However, considering the piece-count and parts available when it was released, this is a great-looking set - it is, after all, unmistakably a forklift.

The best part of this set, however, was the forklift component itself. Its sprung mechanism made it great for lifting the supplied load, as well as being the perfect launch-pad sending your little bricks sky-high!

Considering it small size and low piece-count, this set had tons of playability. From shifting loads to launching parts to supplying a minifigure, this set has a lot to offer a child's imagination and an adults appreciation. I recommend it for both adult collectors and children with an imagination.

Pros

  • Easy build even without the instructions.
  • Excellent use of available parts
  • Lots of playability
  • Sprung fork-lift part!

Cons

  • No modern mini-fig
  • A bit blocky-looking compared to modern sets

In comparison to modern kits, this set looks rather primitive. On the other hand, if you want simple playable model that invokes 70s LEGO nostalgia, then look no further.
